member.name: M:BuildControllerExtensions.GetGameObject(Buildron.Domain.Mods.IBuildController[],Buildron.Domain.Builds.IBuild)
member.summary: Gets the game object that is holding the specified build as modeol.

member.name: T:Buildron.Domain.Mods.ICameraProxy
member.summary: Defines an interface to a camera proxy.
member.remarks: The main responsibility of this interface is to control access of the various mods to the Buildron's main camera and avoid more than one mod tries to change exclusive values, like camera position, in the same time.

member.name: M:Buildron.Domain.Mods.ICameraProxy.RegisterController``1(Buildron.Domain.Mods.CameraControllerKind,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Registers the controller by specifying the kind and if the controller should register as an exclusive controller to camera kind. The previous register controller will be disabled if any exclusive control was requested by CameraControllerKind.
member.remarks: CameraControllerKind is a flag enum, so you can combine them to register a camera controller to more than one kind.

member.name: M:Buildron.Domain.Mods.ICameraProxy.UnregisterController``1
member.summary: Unregisters the controller and enable again the previous one registered.

member.name: T:Buildron.Domain.Mods.IGameObjectsPoolProxy
member.summary: Defines an interface to a game objects pool proxy.
member.remarks: Mods can use this interface to create any number of pools of game objects.

member.name: M:Buildron.Domain.Mods.IGameObjectsPoolProxy.CreatePool(System.String,System.Func{UnityEngine.GameObject})
member.param: The name of the pool. The same name used here should be used on GetGameObject and ReleaseGameObject methods.
The game object factory or how each instance of game object that will used on the pool will be created.

member.name: M:Buildron.Domain.Mods.IGameObjectsPoolProxy.GetGameObject(System.String,System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the game object from the pool.
member.remarks: If there is a free game object on the pool, this will be used. If there is no free game object, a new one will be created.
member.param: The time, in seconds, to auto disable the game object and put it back to pool (free to be used again). Zero (0) to not auto disable.

member.name: M:Buildron.Domain.Mods.IGameObjectsPoolProxy.ReleaseGameObject(System.String,UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Releases the game object back to pool (free to be used again).

member.name: T:Buildron.Domain.Mods.IFileSystemProxy
member.summary: Defines an interface to a file system proxy.

member.name: M:Buildron.Domain.Mods.IFileSystemProxy.GetFiles(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the files on the path using the search pattern.
member.param: The path of the where should get the files. Use relative values here, because you don't know where is your mods folder.
If should search in subdirectories recursively.

member.name: M:Buildron.Domain.Mods.IFileSystemProxy.GetDirectories(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the directories on the paht using the search pattern.
member.param: The path of the where should get the directories. Use relative values here, because you don't know where is your mods folder.
If should search in subdirectories recursively.

member.name: T:Buildron.Domain.Mods.IBuildGameObjectsProxy
member.summary: Defines an interface to build game objects proxy.

member.name: M:Buildron.Domain.Mods.IBuildGameObjectsProxy.GetAll
member.summary: Get all instances that implement IBuildController interface.
member.remarks: This method will return all implementations of IBuildController instanced from all mods, so, this useful when you want that your mod do something related to all builds game objects. See a sample of this on Buildron.ClassicMods.CameraMod that use this method to know how to move the camera to show all builds game objects.
member.returns: All IBuildController implentations intancs on Buildron right now.

member.name: M:FileSystemProxyExtensions.SearchFiles(Buildron.Domain.Mods.IFileSystemProxy,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Search for files on entire mod exclusive file system.
member.param: If the search should be recursive.

member.name: M:FileSystemProxyExtensions.SearchDirectories(Buildron.Domain.Mods.IFileSystemProxy,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Search for directories on entire mod exclusive file system.
member.param: If the search should be recursive.

member.name: T:Buildron.Domain.Mods.IUserGameObjectsProxy
member.summary: Defines an interface to user game objects proxy.

member.name: M:Buildron.Domain.Mods.IUserGameObjectsProxy.GetAll
member.summary: Get all instances that implement IUserController interface.
member.remarks: This method will return all implementations of IUserController instanced from all mods, so, this useful when you want that your mod do something related to all user game objects. See a sample of this on Buildron.ClassicMods.CameraMod that use this method to know how to move the camera to show all users game objects.
member.returns: All IUserController implentations intancs on Buildron right now.

member.name: T:Buildron.Domain.Mods.IUserController
member.summary: Defines an interface to game objects that act as an user game object controller.
member.remarks: While is not mandatory you use this interface on your user game objects, it's highly recommended that you implement it, because this allow others mods know what are the currently user game objects and react to them, like Buildron.ClassicMods.CameraMod that move the camera to show all user game objects.

member.name: T:Buildron.Domain.Mods.IGameObjectController
member.summary: Defines a basic interface to game object controllers.
member.remarks: This is interface is commonly used by mods that want to do something about game objects created by other mods, like builds and users.

member.name: T:Buildron.Domain.Mods.IBuildController
member.summary: Defines an interface to game objects that act as an build game object controller.
member.remarks: While is not mandatory you use this interface on your build game objects, it's highly recommended that you implement it, because this allow others mods know what are the currently build game objects and react to them, like Buildron.ClassicMods.CameraMod that move the camera to show all build game objects.
